entry.title: Go Low Capacity Binary
entry.summary: Let's learn how to build a Go application with minimum capacity and deploy it as a container image.
entry.content:
Let's learn how to build a Go application with minimum capacity and deploy it as a container image.

Dockerfileâ€‹

Dockerfile
FROM golang:alpine as builder
COPY . .
RUN apk update && \
  apk upgrade && \
  apk add --no-cache ca-certificates && \
  apk add --update-cache tzdata && \
  update-ca-certificates
RUN echo "nobody:x:65534:65534:nobody:/:" > /etc_passwd
ENV GO111MODULE=on
ENV CGO_ENABLED=0
ENV GOOS=linux
ENV GOARCH=amd64
WORKDIR /build
RUN go mod download
RUN go build -a -ldflags '-s' -o /main .

FROM scratch
COPY --from=builder /etc_passwd /etc/passwd
COPY --from=builder /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt /etc/ssl/certs/
COPY --from=builder /usr/local/go/lib/time/zoneinfo.zip /
COPY --from=builder /main .
ENV ZONEINFO=/zoneinfo.zip
EXPOSE 8080
USER nobody
ENTRYPOINT ["./main"]

entry.title: Discussion about Go Language and Project Structure
entry.summary: This is a discussion about the directory structure of Go applications.
entry.content:
This is a discussion about the directory structure of Go applications.

Introduction to Goâ€‹

I got to know Go on the 2015 podcast "I'm a Programmer" episode "The Go Language Attraction of Google Engineers". Yeom Jae-hyun, who worked as a Google engineer, appeared on the show and talked about the Go language while publishing a book called "Discovery Go". And I did a little tutorial through a Go study group, but I haven't actually used Go in practice since.

Glassdome uses Go language to develop applications.

The Benefits of Goâ€‹

First off, Go is quite popular in the industry. It's a language that I believe will continue to be popular.

The syntax resembles C, which is learned in basically any school.

At the same time, it is easier to use than C. (obviously)

Furthermore, it performs better than VM or script engine-based languages.

Another advantage that I found was,

Go applications are statically compiled, minimizing runtime dependence, and are very small when built with a container image.

Empty container without even an OS can only be run by inserting the Go binary. Therefore, it takes less time to upload images when developing and deploying, and less time to download container images from the Kubernetes node and less time to prepare for execution.

Go Container Image Size

When you build a Web application server with JVM or NodeJS, no matter how small you try to make it, it can easily exceed 100MBs and even become hundreds of MBs. On the other hand, you can create a Go container of less than 10 MB even if you include all the packages you need.

Install Goâ€‹

tip

We recommend that you install it as a GVM.

gvm install go1.19

Go Project Structureâ€‹

Because Go syntax is easy, developers who have used other programming languages can adapt quickly.

But sometimes when looking at the code you might not know what to do.

For example, how do you capture the directory structure of the Go project?

Today I'm going to talk about this.

info

The document you want to refer to is Standard Go Project Layout.

The Go Project is a Moduleâ€‹

Since Go 1.14, Go has had the the concept of a Module.

Before the Go Module came out, Go had a structure where dependency packages were gathered and installed in the same place the execution environment was installed (GOPATH); which is similar to Python.

info

Similarly, if you do not use venv in Python the package is installed in the python installation path python-x.y.z/site-packages/.

But we don't need to go over old information, you can consider all the latest Go releases as using Go Modules.

Dependent packages are managed separately for each module.

info

Go Module = Project (in other languages)

Getting Started with Go Moduleâ€‹

Let's make a module called mymodule.

mkdir mymodule
cd mymodule

go mod init github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

The file go.mod is created.

go.mod
module github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

go 1.19

No Separate src Directory, module is root packageâ€‹

In JVM languages, including Java, the path that the compiler recognizes as a source code file is conventionally defined as src/main/java.

But instead of having that rule in Go, the Go module directory itself becomes the root package for that module.

If you look at many Go open source projects hosted on GitHub, you can see that the repository itself is a Go Module that contains the source code *.go directly in the root directory.

+ mymodule/
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

You can also put the go.mod and source code *.go files side by side in the module root directory.

myfile.go
package mymodule

func Xxx() {
  ...
}

The main package (entry point code) is located under the cmd/ directoryâ€‹

main.go
package main

func main() {
  ...
}

The entry point code for the Go application is written in a reserved package called main. However, the main package cannot be placed in the same directory as any other generic package. If you place main.go in the root path of the module, it will take away the root package digits (most importantly) where the other source code files will fit.

Therefore, main.go is placed in the cmd/ directory instead of the module's root path.

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

(We don't really execute this well) If there are multiple entry points, place them in each subdirectory under cmd/.

caution

There can only be 0~1 main in each directory

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-+ main1
| | +-- main.go
| +-+ main2
|   +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go
caution

entry.title: Updating Packages Periodically (brew, nvm, npm, yarn, etc.)
entry.content:
TL;DRâ€‹

brew update
brew upgrade
nvm install --lts
npm install -g npm
npm install -g yarn

It is recommended that you upgrade your package as soon as a new version or patch comes out.

Please upgrade at least once a week.

info

I do it once a week.

Upgrading the homebrew Packageâ€‹

Upgrade several packages at once.

brew update
brew upgrade

node, npm, yarn Upgradeâ€‹

Upgrade NodeJS.

nvm install --lts

Upgrade npm.com/try-the-latest-stable-version-of-npm#upgrading-on-nix-osx-linux-etc).

npm install -g npm

Upgrade yarn.

npm install -g yarn
tip

Instead of installing yarn separately, it is more convenient to install it as an npm package.

NVM is a tool that allows you to install multiple versions of NodeJS and replace them as needed.

TypeScript and NodeJSâ€‹

The following programming languages are commonly used in Glassdome:

  • Software Development Team

    • Frontend Client Web Application Development: TypeScript
  • Infra Team: Go, TypeScript
  • AI/Data Team: Python

Among them, the Infra team needs a scripting language for cloud development and infrastructure management, mainly using TypeScript.

NodeJS is required to run TypeScript so NodeJS must be installed first.

NVM (Node Version Manager)â€‹

NVM is a tool that allows you to install multiple versions of NodeJS and replace them as needed.

tip

Similarly, Go has GVM) that installs and manages multiple versions.

Let's assume the following circumstances:

  • Use Node 16 for AWS Lambda Function
  • Use Node 17 when developing front-end web applications
  • Server applications use Node 18

Because you have to install multiple versions on one PC, upgrade or patch versions, and switch between them it would be very inconvenient to simply install one version.

So I don't recommend following the download and installation instructions on the NodeJS website.

It is more convenient to use NVM to install NodeJS and manage the version.

entry.title: Windows on Linux: WSL2
entry.content:
WSL2: Windows Subsystem for Linux 2â€‹

WSL stands for "Windows Subsystem for Linux", a tool that makes Linux available to Windows.

Before WSL came out, we used [Cygwin] (https://www.cygwin.com/)) or a method of installing a Linux distribution (such as Ubuntu) as a VM on a PC. Cygwin is not a complete Linux implementation, however, and installing Linux as a VM is costly. Instead, WSL makes it convenient for Windows to use Linux.

Advantages of WSLâ€‹

WSL2 allows Windows PC users to have the same user experience as they do with the Darwin operating system. Installing and using WSL has the following advantages:

  • You can easily install the tools you need by using a package manager such as homebrew.
  • In many cases, you can quickly solve any problems using linux shell commands

Above all, when documenting any troubleshooting method, Windows users and macOS users do not have to write separate solutions which optimizes the team's communication and development productivity.

Disadvantages of WSLâ€‹

WSL is different from the actual Linux distribution and cannot be used for servers. (systemd not supported)

Instead, there is virtually no downside for us to use PCs.

How to installâ€‹

Open PowerShell with administrator privileges

wsl --install
